result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Scott Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Aaron Scott Johnson in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DEF pleads No Contest to Counts #1 and #2.  Count #3 is dismissed, but read in.  State waives Pre-Sentence Investigation. 
Ct #1:  Found guilty.  Sentence STAYED: 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision consecutive to Ct #2.  DEF is placed on probation for 3 years consecutive to jail time in 15CF73 and Count #2.  Costs $443 including DNA surcharge and DEF must submit DNA tissue sample.   Anger management counseling and complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.    Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.
Ct #2: Found Guilty. Sentence imposed: 20 days county jail, with Huber, consecutive to 15CF73, credit for 14 days time served.   Report to jail immediately- 4-14-15 3:00 pm.   Fine/costs $1505.00   Pay obligation today or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.  Pay blood draw costs to Sawyer county Sheriff $23.45.    DL revoked 16 months, IID 16 months   On any vehicle owned or operated, commencing 8-03-15.

Defendant Aaron Scott Johnson in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF waives Preliminary Hearing.  State files the Information.  Parties have reached agreement and hearing moves on to Plea/Sentencing.

Defendant Aaron S. Johnson in court with Attorney Scott Schlough by phone.  Bruce Poquette for the State.  OFF record.  Adjourned initial appearance set for April 14, 2015 at 1:30pm (track along with 14CF193).

Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a STOP case manager (715-638-3317)for the purpose of  learning about the Court's intoxicated driver intervention program.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
